title: Favorite Columbus Restaurants
name: Favorite Columbus Restaurants
description:
A Map by Bran740

This is a list of all of my favorite places to eat in Columbus Ohio.

properties.name: Barcelona
properties.description: Posted by Bran740263 East Whittier Street columbus oh 43206Slightly pricy for the small portions, but is an excellent special occasion place. Service is stellar and the food is delicious. The atmosphere and often live music more than makes up for the small portions.

properties.name: Bravo
properties.description: Posted by Bran7403000 Hayden Rd, Dublin, 43016 Good italian place. Great wood fired pizzas. Pork chops are very good as well.

properties.name: Cafe Brioso
properties.description: Posted by Bran740 14 E Gay St columbus oh 43215Want to get the best coffee beans (and the best coffee) in town? Come here. This guys roasts it all, and knows everything about coffee.

properties.name: Columbus Fish Market
properties.description: Posted by Bran7401245 Olentangy River Road columbus ohGreat seafood place. Another Cameron Mitchell restaurant like Molly Woo\'s. A little on the pricy side, but worth it.

properties.name: Cup O' Joe
properties.description: Posted by Bran740 627 S. Third Street Columbus OHGreat Coffee Shop next door to the German Village Book Loft.

properties.name: Goody Boy
properties.description: Posted by Bran7401144 N High St columbus ohGreat Diner. Limited Seating, low prices and excellent food. Go for breakfast and get the Mary Lou Herkie: 2 eggs, toast, choice of meat and coffee for .25.

properties.name: Harvest Moon Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Bran740 7 N High St canal winchester ohFantastic coffee shop offering live music and laid back atmosphere.

properties.name: Hong Kong Buffet
properties.description: Posted by Bran7401831 W Henderson Rd columbus ohThe place that made me like Chinese Food. Go for the lunch buffet.

properties.name: Hound Dogs Pizza
properties.description: Posted by Bran7402659 N. High Street Columbus, OHReally great pizza at a good price. Very large selection of toppings, definately worth experimenting. This place is 24 hours and has live music much of the time.

properties.name: J. Alexander's
properties.description: Posted by Bran7407550 Vantage Dr columbus ohExcellent steakhouse. The rest of the menu is equally good, but I had the best Filet Mignon of my life there.

properties.name: Jack and Benny's
properties.description: Posted by Bran7402563 N High St columbus ohExcellent breakfast place. I\'ve only had breakfast, so I have no idea what the rest of the menu is like. Id recommend the Chorizo Scramble

properties.name: Johnny's Pizza
properties.description: Posted by Bran7401336 Parsons Ave columbus ohOne of my favorite pizza places in Columbus. Probably number 1, but it has some competition with Hound Dogs. This style pizza is your typical square cut "dive" style...but oh so good. Especially with the cornmeal on the bottom of the crust.

properties.name: Mac's Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Bran740 693 N High St columbus oh 43215Great bar that offers scottish fare. The daily soups are excellent, as are the mild buffalo wings. Some of the scottish food is bland (and thus authentic) but much of the rest of the menu is very good.

properties.name: Molly Woo's
properties.description: Posted by Bran7401500 Polaris Pkwy columbus ohExcellent Asian food. Everything from the tea to the desserts are fantastic.

properties.name: North Market
properties.description: Posted by Bran740 59 Spruce St, Columbus, OHFantastic market with vendors selling produce, meat, flowers, alcohol, coffee, ice cream, all kinds of food, clothing and on and on. You can find the "best Pad Thai in Columbus" here as well as a double scoop of "Cayenne Mint" or "Cabernet Gelatto" at Jeni\'s Ice Cream.

properties.name: Old Bag of Nails
properties.description: Posted by Bran740663 High St, Worthington, OHExcellent Restaurant/Bar. Burgers are fantastic. Clam Chowder you can eat with a fork and fish and chips are some of the best I\'ve had.

properties.name: Pistachio
properties.description: Posted by Bran740680 N. Pearl St., Columbus, OHNot really a restaurant, but you can get everything possible made from a pistachio. really excellent desserts, wines and gifts.

properties.name: Plank's Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Bran740 743 Parsons Avenue Columbus OHExcellent place to get pizza. Others may disagree on the crust, since they add sugar to it, but I think it\'s excellent. They offer a much bigger menu, but I\'ve never had anything else.

properties.name: Schmidt's Restaurant und Sausage Haus
properties.description: Posted by Bran740 240 East Kossuth Street Columbus OHExcellent german fare and pastries. Definately worth having a meal and dessert.

properties.name: Scotty McBean's
properties.description: Posted by Bran740 4675 north high st columbus ohGreat Coffee house and restaurant. You can buy a good cup of coffee, or buy beans in bulk. Their menu is also very good, offering scottish style food. And the men wear kilts. Awesome.

properties.name: Thurman Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Bran740 183 Thurman Ave Columbus OH Bar/Tavern where you can get fantastic burgers. Split the .00 Thurman Burger two ways and leave completely satisfied.

properties.name: Victorians Midnight Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Bran740 251 w fifth ave columbus ohLots and lots of memories for me at this place. It\'s no longer called the "Big Ass Garlic Toast", but it\'s still big and it\'s still good. Their subs continue to be good as well as their coffee. Open mic night is typically quite and experience.

properties.name: Zeta's European Emporium
properties.description: Posted by Bran740751 N High St columbus oh 43215Others will say "The Happy Greek" just down the street offers a better Gyro. I disagree. Nowhere else in Columbus can you order a Gyro from a Husband/Wife combo who immigrated from greece and still speak to each other in greek. And for dollars, you can\'t beat this absolutely delicious and filling Gyro. Try the Special Hummus and Baklava.
